description.full: Valid US phone numbers can be either seven (no area code) or ten digits (incl. area code) long. In practice you can see these numbers written in a variety of formats, but it'd be nice if we could format valid phone numbers similarly. Write a function that converts valid phone numbers into a standard format. Valid seven-digit numbers should follow the pattern `XXX-XXXX`. Valid ten-digit numbers should follow the pattern `(XXX) XXX-XXXX`. Invalid phone numbers (not seven or ten digits) should return `undefined`.
